data.title: Important pipeline bug fix.
data.body:
This is simple and effecient solution for #3230 problem. 

How could I found this solution ? I insert changed Pipeline.exe to original tools folder and found that Main function misses the arguments completely at some point, for reason I dont solved. Probably the thing called IsolationStorage is guilty.. I still think its a temporary fix and whole pipeline should be checked to resolve this problem completly.

But for now this patch removes this problem from developer eyes.

data.title: WP8.1 Multitouch slowdown
data.body:
Hi! I'm trying to port my games on WP8.1 with Monogame 3.2.3 (via NuGet -pre version).

But I notice in one of my game (which is based on multitouch gameplay 4+ touches at once) that if I touch screen with 3 fingers and move them I get fps drop and if I touch it and move with 7+ finger it's drop even more and can even freeze until I go back in WP menu and back again. Even if I have no touch code at all. 

It can be reproduce in empty WP8.1 project with monogame template (with 3d cube in it), touch it with 5-10 fingers and frame will freeze. Here is the video: http://youtu.be/gSrUaaTeFFk

data.title: Fullscreen enabling for WindowsDX
data.body:
This experimental commit enables IsFullscreen in constructor, and in another methods with ApplyChange and also fixes ToggleFullScreen. Only for WindowsDX platform. Tested with XNA.

This is "soft" version - The window is just stretch up and loses borders.

Because these things already arent working it doesnt matter if my changes break them a bit.

data.title: Replacing XNA Namespaces

milestone.title: 4.0 Release
milestone.description: Major new API to support the new graphics libraries like Metal, Vulkan, and DirectX 12.

data.body:
A few years ago we discussed replacing the `Microsoft.Xna.` namespace with `MonoGame.`, but we felt it was too soon as WP7 and Xbox 360 was still pretty active.

So are we getting closer?  Is 2015 the year we make this move?

Can we use some sort of assembly alias as a fallback for older code?

What are issues to consider?  Like how would things like binary deserialization be affected which depend on `ContentTypeReader` names?

data.title: Excluding dead zone from final thumbstick output range
data.body:
Hey there,

I found a strange behavior in thumbsticks values. When pushing a thumbstick toward the min/max of an axis, the other axis is clamped to some extent. This results in thumbsticks being inaccurate or sticked to the min/max of an axis.

Example: when I fully push a thumbstick to the right (0.0f;1.0f), then if I steer slowly up/down, there is a range of about 10Â° where the values are blocked to (0.0f;1.0f).

The culprit is `GamePadDeadZone.IndependentAxes`. https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/fcf6e5d5646f8d5e06d02c72c01ed881e2f0563f/MonoGame.Framework/Input/GamePad.XInput.cs#L196
Independently calculating axis dead zone for thumbsticks is not relevant. Thumbsticks should behave like circular inputs even if they are on independent axes driver-wise. Hence, I simplified `ConvertThumbStick` to proceed all data as circular.

As far as I checked, it only concerns the XInput / Windows target.

data.title: Update the MG Installer description on the develop branch to state it's a DEV install
data.body:
Currently the installer builder still states that it is the MonoGame 3.2 installer

This is terribly confusion for anyone downloading the development release from the develop branch auto creation scripts.

As the MG 3.2 installer is already fixed, can this be updated to either:
- MonoGame Dev release (plus date)
- MonoGame 3.3 Development release
- Something other than MonoGame 3.2

This will help a lot in tutorials and ensure when you are using the dev release you know what on earth you are installing.

Same with the assembly version if this can be configured to automatically increment, with the minor release number updated AFTER each official release, e.g dev should be at lease 3.3.x now.

data.title: iOS touch positions are incorrect
data.body: If I tap the bottom of the screen the Y of the position is 623 instead of 640 (screen resolution 1136x640). If I tap the top of the screen the Y of the position is 0 and if I tap slightly below it it is still 0 (but it should be more than 0). It seems that I get touch positions as if my app had a status bar and therefore all positions are offset by 17 pixels. Reproduced on both iOS 7.1 and iOS 8.1.

data.title: graphics.IsFullScreen = true; (not working)
Pipeline tool - context menu terminology
data.body:
The difference between the "New Item" and "Add Item" context menu entries in the pipeline tool isn't obvious without clicking through to see what each does.

I suggest renaming "Add Item" to "Add Existing Item". This would be consistent with VS terminology (which I'm guessing a lot of users will be using anyways), and will make it so that you can instantly determine the purpose of both of these menu items.

data.title: Pipeline tool - add ability to manually create folders
data.body:
It would be useful to be able to add folders to a content project directly from the Pipeline tool. A user should be able to, in the project tree, right-click a node and either include a "Folder" option in the "New Item" popup, or a "New Folder" entry should be added to the context menu. The same should be done in the "Edit" menu.

This would be useful so that, if a user wants to re-structure their project, they can just add new folders and drag content around within the tool.

data.title: SpriteBatch comments / Begin unification
data.body: SpriteBatch now fully documented, Begin is cutted to a version with optional parameters. Please improve mine translation skills if you finding errors.
